businessmodel

Class AssemblyLine

  • java.lang.Object
    • businessmodel.AssemblyLine

  • public class AssemblyLine
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that represents an assembly line. It holds 3 work post.
    Author:
    SWOP team 10 2014

    • Field Summary

      private java.util.ArrayList<WorkPost> workposts
      List of work posts at the assembly line.

    • Method Detail

      • getWorkPosts

        public java.util.ArrayList<WorkPost> getWorkPosts()
        This method returns the list of work posts at the assembly line.
        Returns:
        this.workposts

      • canAdvance

        public boolean canAdvance()
        This method checks whether the assembly line can move forward.
        Returns:
        boolean true is the assembly line can move forward. false otherwise.

      • advance

        public Order advance(Order neworder)
        This method advances the Assembly Line. It adds the supplied order to the first work post and moves the rest forward. If the last WorkPost was working on an Order. That order is finished and is returned.
        Parameters:
        neworder - The Order that is added at the front of the line.
        Returns:
        finished A finished order if the last WorkPost was working on an Order.

      • getWorkPostOrders

        protected java.util.LinkedList<Order> getWorkPostOrders()
        A method that returns all the orders that are on the assembly line.
        Returns:
        LinkedList A list with all the orders that are on the assembly line.

      • generateWorkPosts

        private void generateWorkPosts(java.util.ArrayList<Action> actions)
        A method to generate all the responsible assembly tasks of a work post.
        Parameters:
        actions - the actions of all the work posts.
